data.nodeTypeDescription: This is the Root Node, from which the rest of the graph is built.
data.label: Root Node

data.nodeTypeDescription: This is the starting point for your bot's Behavior Tree logic.
data.label: Top Level Sequence Node

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is Bot Active?

data.displayDescription: Action nodes represent complex actions (e.g., 'open the door').
data.label: Perform Action

data.displayDescription: Selector nodes execute children in order until one of them returns Success or all children return Failure. This is like an OR operator.
data.label: Do A thing?

data.displayDescription: This node returns Running if its child returns Running, Failure if the child returns Success, and Success if the child returns Failure.
data.label: Node 6

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is there a player nearby?

data.displayDescription: This node returns Running if its child returns Running. Otherwise, this node always returns Failure regardless of the child's status.
data.label: Node 8

data.displayDescription: This node returns Running if its child returns Running. Otherwise, this node always returns Success regardless of the child's status.
data.label: Node 9

data.displayDescription: This node returns Running if its child returns Running. Otherwise, this node always returns Failure regardless of the child's status.
data.label: Node 13

data.label: Node 14
